intro: Malanea panurensis, commonly known as the Panurensis Malanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often covered in a fine pubescence. Malanea panurensis is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
